1500157677908942857.text: I commend President Zelensky’s courageous leadership and the Ukrainian people’s resilience. We must support them in their pursuit for a sovereign and democratic nation.

1500157629179514882.text: In coordination with our NATO allies, we must continue to provide critical security assistance to bolster the Ukrainian resistance, send humanitarian aid to mitigate the growing refuge crisis, ban Russian oil imports to the U.S., and continue to punish Putin for his lawless war.

1500157577518325772.text: This morning, I joined a virtual meeting with Ukrainian President Zelensky and bipartisan members of congress.

Despite real progress in the last year, this remains a challenging moment for the country.

#SOTU22

I know from personal experience — early cancer detection makes all the difference.

Let's end cancer as we know it. #SOTU

Childhood poverty doesn't have to be a permanent feature of our democracy.

.@POTUS is right — the present tax system ain't fair.

The decision allowed kids to attend the school most convenient to them.

1445761453043052544.text: Today, RCV is used in some form in 29 states, including Colorado, Maine, and Minnesota. States and cities across the country understand that our political system is desperate for creative reforms to break the partisan fever and make government work again for the American people.

1445761354032320519.text: #RankedChoiceVoting is the fastest growing reform in America because it gives people more choices, increases political competition, eliminates costly runoffs, and rewards candidates who appeal to the broadest swath of voters.

1445761285665136643.text: Instead of voting for a single candidate, #RCV lets you rank candidates in order of preference. If no candidate wins a majority outright, the last-place candidate is eliminated and you take their voters' next choice into account. Learn more about it here: https://t.co/idn4OMEZoG

1436731309930520585.text: They did their duty to our nation, and their example calls on us to do the same -- by learning from the past 20 years, correcting course where we must, and coming together in common purpose.

1436731308470935552.text: As we reflect on the past 20 yrs, we must remember the 3,000 Americans lost that terrible morning, along w/ the men & women who gave their lives in Afghanistan & Iraq, our veterans who still bear wounds of war (many, invisible) & first responders who still struggle w/ sickness.

1436731306902163456.text: Strategic global leadership became reckless unilateralism and nation-building. Then and now, politicians played to our darkest impulses of fear, hatred, and isolation at the expense of our highest ideals.

1436731305362968577.text: The attacks brought out the best in our nation -- courage, resolve, and resilience -- but they also set in motion challenges that remain with us today. Powerful unity gave way to intense partisan division.

1436731303781613575.text: On 9/11 2001, terrorists attacked our nation and our democratic way of life. They failed. Twenty years later, America still has the strongest economy in the world, the most capable fighting force ever assembled, and, despite our challenges, the oldest democracy in human history.

1267862125122326528.text:
We will never heal as a country until we fully confront and dismantle the systemic racism that plagues every aspect of our society. 

As a white male and a United States Senator, it is my duty to use my platform and position to do this.

1267861443560583168.text: This week, I returned to work in a capitol building whose stones were placed by enslaved human beings. American slavery is not ancient history. Our country enslaved human beings less than a hundred years before I was born in 1964.

1267860980891037696.text: You can draw a straight line from slavery to Jim Crow to the redlining of our banking and housing systems to mass incarceration to the recent killing of black people from Georgia to Minnesota.

1267860525381287937.text: If you have been paying any attention, if you have listened to voices in the black community and studied our history, then you know these injustices have been with us for generations and grown worse in recent decades.

1267860022803005441.text: In recent days, many have observed that the current pandemic has exposed profound inequality in our society. We should not have needed a pandemic to see this.

1267859623593283585.text: What happened to George Floyd would never happen to my daughters. It would never happen to me. That is the reality we face, the reality thousands are protesting in Colorado and across the country, and the reality we must change.

1267859185871605762.text: When I worked for the City and County of Denver, one of the first tragedies we confronted was the unjustified shooting of a black teenager named Paul Childs by law enforcement in Park Hill. That was almost 20 years ago. Nothing has changed.

1267858668055334913.text: It’s been one week since the world watched Minneapolis police kill George Floyd. You cannot watch the video without feeling sick, without remembering Ahmaud Arbery, Breonna Taylor & the countless other Americans who have lost their lives in this country because they were black.

1267846637193478144.text:

1256315495927742464.text: All personally identifiable information collected to fight COVID-19 must be deleted or de-identified upon termination of the disease cycle, as determined by public health experts.

1256315352922951682.text: At the federal level, the CDC must remain the sole entity responsible for managing COVID data. No private third party, state government, or other federal department, including law enforcement or national security agencies, should have access to such data.

1256315161448611840.text: Any data collected must be used exclusively for the public benefit and must not be shared with third parties for monetization or private gain of any kind, including businesses, nonprofits, and consortia thereof.

1256314990660710400.text:
Americans must be given the choice to opt-in to any data collection related to COVID-19 and have a clear right to refuse.

Individuals must also have the right to remove their data if they choose.

1256314858959749123.text:
As the world races to apply digital tools to fight the pandemic, the U.S. should set an example for how to balance their potential value with their limitations and risks.

@SenAngusKing @RepDeanPhillips #RCV is no silver bullet for our political dysfunction, but it is precisely the kind of bold and innovative reform we should consider to restore and reinvigorate our democracy. 

That’s why we need the #VoterChoiceAct.

1233105908680527874.text: @SenAngusKing @RepDeanPhillips By rewarding candidates for being someone’s second or third choice, #RCV penalizes extreme slash-and-burn politics and rewards candidates who stay positive, focus on the issues, and appeal to the broadest number of voters.

1233105760697167872.text: @SenAngusKing @RepDeanPhillips #RCV lets voters pick their first choice without accidentally helping elect their last choice –  increasing political competition and bringing new voices into our politics. It also helps ensure that the ultimate winner represents a true majority of voters.

1233105467666313222.text:
@SenAngusKing @RepDeanPhillips In most elections, you vote for one person and the person with the most votes wins. Downside? Candidates can win without earning a majority of all votes. 

Voting for your favorite, lesser-known candidate can also waste your vote and can help elect your least favorite candidate.

1233104937216856064.text:
@SenAngusKing @RepDeanPhillips A partisan fever is imperiling our democracy. We believe #RCV can lower the temperature by giving voters more choices, discouraging slash-and-burn politics, and rewarding candidates who appeal to a broad majority. 

Here’s how ⬇️

1233104676385624066.text: Today @SenAngusKing, @RepDeanPhillips, and I are introducing the #VoterChoiceAct to provide $40 million to help local and state governments that wish to transition to a form of ranked choice voting for their elections. #RCV https://t.co/fv5gllgU4S
